ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I took this course because i'm really interested in tropical biology. It was a good mix of biology andconservation.
I think this course could be more challening. I think florencia has a TON of experience, and she could delve deeper....
This is a great overview of Tropical Forest Ecology as it applies to all regions of the tropics.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Lots of different topics were discussed.
The professor's teaching style
The inclusion of guest speakers who are actively involved in the field was very interesting and brought a different perspective to the class.

My own discpiline to read the articles (few other students did) and the questions I asked in class was the best way for me to learn. Florencia is brilliant, but sometimes just shares rudimentary information.
The small class facilitated a close relationship between the students and the professor and TA. Professor Montagnini took a genuine interest in the students and their questions.
The best aspects of this course is a really good introduction to ecology of related topics. It does not put too much attention to species, terms, but include necessary ones.

I liked the diversity of topics covered, ranging from savanna ecosystems to sustainable forest management. I also liked the order of the lectures, with the ecological and ecosystem-specific lectures making up the first half of the course and the management-based lectures making up the second half of the course.I really appreciated the professor's willingness to answer students' questions and her encouragement of student participation, which greatly increased my learning in the course.I liked that the final assignments were a presentation and paper, allowing each student to focus on a single topic of interest to apply the course's concepts.I greatly enjoyed the guest lecturers, as well.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: None
More examples from all the tropical forests - especially Africa
Make it a little more advanced!
I think the course focus too much in Latin America area... Maybe add more about Asia and Africa.

Many of the lectures were too a little too long for the designated class period, causing the professor to speed through slides towards the end of the slide deck. If the lectures were made a bit shorter, then there would be more time to present the material and for students to digest it.The study guide for the midterm was not as helpful as it could have been, with many topics on it that were not on the test.While the requirements for formatting, etc., were made very clear, expectations for the type of argument and the kind of research for the final paper and presentation were not very clear. It would have been helpful to have more details in regard to whether, for instance, the students were expected to simply perform a thorough literature review, or if they were expected to also make recommendations and/or do a thorough case study analysis, etc.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: No discussion section.
No sections but lots of 'show&tell'
It was totally lecture based.
N/A

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: It doesn't particularly, I took it out of interest in the topic area.
I am from and will be working in a tropical country

I am doing forestry research in the tropics. I would have liked to see a little more focus on ecosystem services/payments for ecosystem services and management, but almost all of the class focused on the science of tropical forests.
I am interested in sustainable land use in developing countries.
Since I hope to specialize in forestry and agroforestry projects in Latin America, this topic was very germane to my interests.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Interested in tropical ecology and forest conservation.
To learn more about tropical forests
I am doing research on deforestation and flooding in the tropics.
I am studying sustainable land use in developing countries.
I wanted to gain a deeper understanding of the ecology of tropical forest ecosystems, in order to better manage forestry or agroforestry projects in these ecosystems in the future.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes
Yes On a scale of 1-5: 4.5
Yes
I learned a good deal, but wish I could have learned more.
Yes. This was a great overview of Tropical Forest Ecology covering many different topics and regions of the world.
Yes, I think I got what I need.
Yes, my expectations were met, however, I would have also liked to have more lab-based skill development (ie, practice using tools to measure soil quality, light in the understory, etc).

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: No group work.
We had a group practice section for our final presentation
Group study on the midterm is very useful.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Take it if it is offered again. If you want to work in the tropics Professor Montagnini is a great person to know and she has lots of insight into tropical forestry to offer.

This course is prettyintroductory. If you have taken tropical forest of ecology class before, this class is too easy. I had never taken ecology, so I thought this class was just about my speed. Others felt pretty frustrated though.
This class provides a comprehensive view of tropical forest ecology. The term paper is extremely helpful because it allows students to dedicate time to explore a particular area of interest.
If you are an expert on this topic, it may not satisfy you.
Attend class lectures and actively participate.
